title: WATCH: Chick Behind 'Libs of TikTok' Served AOC With A Complaint For Defamation And It Did Not Go Well
description:
If you aren't aware, AOC has a bit of a feud with Chaya Raichik, the lovely lady behind the famed Libs of TikTok account. And they finally met in person. When Chaya served her with an ethics complaint. I'm sure you'll be shocked to find out our socialist darling did not take this well.

Chaya went to AOC's office in the Capitol to deliver the ethics complaint for lying about an American citizen in a committee hearing. AOC wasn't in her office, but luckily, Chaya spotted her while walking through the Capitol and asked for a photo. While they posed for the camera, Chaya revealed she had just dropped off the complaint and said she never inspired a bomb threat. AOC turned and told her, "You're actually super transphobic and I never want to share a space with you."

Dang. That's harsh.

\u201c\ud83d\udea8BREAKING: We served @AOC with an ethics complaint for breaking House rules by intentionally defaming @libsoftiktok.\n\nShe...did not take it well.\n\nThis is the nasty rhetoric of the radical, violent transgender movement.\u201d
— Oversight Project (@Oversight Project) 1680184747

For some background, AOC previously lied about Chaya in a committee hearing with former Twitter executives. Specifically, AOC accused Chaya of lying about Boston Children's Hospital performing sex-change operations on kids, and subsequently blamed her for a bomb threat received by the hospital.

Except, the hospital does perform sex changes on kids. Or at least, they did before everyone found out. Like "gender-affirming hysterectomies". They even said so on their own YouTube page, until people started to notice and they scrubbed all the evidence. A telltale sign of innocence and smear campaigns, obviously.

\u201cBoston Children\u2019s Hospital (@BostonChildrens) is now offering \u201cgender affirming hysterectomies\u201d for young girls https://t.co/JOH5fFtGJ0\u201d
— Libs of TikTok (@Libs of TikTok) 1660237705

Before they were all deleted, Boston Children's Hospital had a whole video series dedicated to detailing the transition process of young teens. This hospital accepted patients seeking top surgery (AKA double mastectomies for girls or breast augmentation for boys) as young as 15 years old, and vaginoplasty at just 17 - though one of the hospitals co-directors said he is "slightly flexible" on the age of males seeking this surgery.

But according to AOC, this is all just a right-wing conspiracy. No one's performing sex changes on children. Only "transphobes" like Libs of TikTok think that.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: WATCH: Karine Jean-Pierre Makes It Clear White House Only Supports Taking Guns Away, Won't Back School Safety
description:
Today, a reporter asked Karine Jean-Pierre if she supports an upcoming bill to be proposed by Tennessee Senator Marsha Blackburn. The bill, dubbed the Safe School Act, would establish a $900 million grant program to allow public and private schools to train and hire veterans and former law enforcement officers to serve as school safety officers. It would also allow schools to hire off duty law enforcement officers and provide funding to increase physical security. So basically, it would solve school shootings. (Kidding. It wouldn't solve them entirely, of course. But it would certainly help.)

The reporter asked KJP if the White House has a stance on this bill, since it would, y'know, protect children. Which they claim to be all about. But instead of answering the question, KJP rambled about everything Biden has done to stop mass shootings thus far before getting to her main point: the only thing they'll support is taking the guns away. Specifically the "assault weapons," of course.

\u201cREPORTER: "The Safe School Act...does the administration have a stance on that?"\n\nJEAN-PIERRE: "We know what works, and that's why we've been calling...for an assault weapons ban."\u201d
— Daily Caller (@Daily Caller) 1680203990

"We have done two dozen executive orders in the past two years - this President has - to do everything that he can to protect communities and our kids. And as we know, we can't do it alone [...] We need Congress to act. And the things that we know are very popular that will actually assist or help prevent gun violence is banning assault weapons [...] And this is something that Republicans won't move on."

I love how she says "we need Congress to act," in response to a question about a bill currently being proposed by U.S. Senators. Meaning, Congress is acting. Just not in the way they want.

If this really were about protecting the kids, Congress and the White House would have passed school safety legislation a looooong time ago. That would in no way prevent them from also trying to ban assault weapons. But it would take away a major selling point - the safety of American children. They're holding that safety hostage to push more gun control. It's hard to stomach, but there's no other explanation.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: Watch: Man recounts the violent way he murdered the three men who molested his kid
description:
Let's toss up the viral video disclaimer right from the get-go. I couldn't find the original source or any references to this video. Mayhaps it's from a movie, or the dude is performing a monologue. @CatchUpNetwork put the clip out on Twitter and there are two things that got me. Not including it was an odd choice for the background music.

The first is the way he went about murdering the men who molested his kid is reminiscent of the torture at the beginning of Wu-Tang Clan's "M.E.T.H.O.D. Man." The second is how you felt the weight this man felt over what happened.

Not all heroes wear capes. pic.twitter.com/T21EX73Sit
— Catch Up (@CatchUpNetwork) March 30, 2023

"I threw one of a third-floor balcony in front of SWAT, and I shot the other two."

"Well...one I electrocuted until he told me how I did it. And then I shot him."

And that's when the man was (allegedly) told they molested his kid...because he had everything.

I agree with the caption "not all heroes wear capes." It's simple. Molest a kid and you gots to go. And if you're the parent, that's where you go into a blind rage. One moment you are knocking on someone's door. The next moment...hey, where'd all this blood come from?

It's rare you hear from the father after the fact. It's rare they want to say anything, let alone want to share their story. Your heart breaks because you know it's not anything this man will ever get over.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Super Mario Bros. star Chris Pratt triggers his haters by...sharing his snack on Instagram?
description:
There are many reasons to love and cherish Super Mario Bros. star Chris Pratt. For me, it's the lack of f*cks he has to give for your usual Hollywood and social media shenanigans. He hates faux-outrage culture and virtue signaling as much as normal people do. And he isn't afraid to mock those who engage in either.

Like the haters who CAN'T EVEN over the way Pratt shares his snacks on Instagram.

Chris Pratt trolls his haters triggered because he *checks notes* shares his snacks on Instagram. pic.twitter.com/PAZEkQyMTQ
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire) March 30, 2023

The video is from 2018, and has been cracking me up for the past five years. Because you know there were real people triggered by #WhatsMySnack -- where Pratt let people guess what snack he was eating that day -- because laughter and levity during the Trump years was frowned upon.

It could very well just be five idiots. Most internet outrage is based off of five idiots with the same dumb opinion, and bloggers who want the clickbait (we can smell our own). The rub is that the faux outrage turns into real outrage when celebrities are compelled to apologize for dumb stuff just because they don't want the headlines. Chris Pratt doesn't have time for such silliness unless he's mocking the silliness.

I also find the lack of "Chris Pratt is Over" parties being thrown since Elon Musk took over. Prior to Elon, all it took was Pratt showing up in the Thor trailer for "Twitter" to "demand" Pratt be canceled. Or, when the actor would post something about his family. You see, the knock on Pratt (by idiots) is that he likes Jesus, America, and hunting. And because he uses his platform to make millions of people happy and NOT attack Trump supporters, leftists hate him. Presumably, the same leftists who would curate what they wanted to trend on Twitter.

Then, other leftists who hate him and who work in digital media would write about how Pratt was being canceled on Twitter. It was a never-ending cycle.

It turns out that when Twitter employees don't have their finger on the scale, Twitter users don't care about the topics those Twitter employees want them to care about. Like, for example, one of the few A-List actors who doesn't validate the now former Twitter employees' worldviews. Go figure.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Watch: Crowder And Gerald Explain How Boycotting 'Pride Nights' Might Force The NHL To Ditch The Gay
description:
Crowder and Gerald brought us some much-needed good news during today's "Gerald Knows Sports" segment. The NHL might just ditch the gay. Literally.

After numerous players have refused to wear Pride jerseys, the NHL may do away with them entirely. Gerald explained how the NHL has had a Pride thing going since 2018, but recent boycotts from notable players have called the practice into question. The players include Ivan Provorov and James Reimer, both of whom cited their Christian faith as the reason for forgoing the rainbow emblems. Gerald and Crowder played a clip of Provorov explaining his choice to stay true to his faith, which is Russian Orthodoxy. Gerald highlighted how, after making these comments, Provorov's jersey sold out.

Another clip showed Reimer explaining that he has to not only believe in, but also live out his Christian faith. Gerald then highlighted an article from The Atlantic that claims Russian players are only doing this because they're scared for their safety in Russia, as well as calls from sports commentators for the players to go back to the country they came from. Which, until today, we all thought was a highly racist and completely unacceptable comment. But it's apparently fine only when you're talking about Eastern European athletes, and they should be forced to violate their religious beliefs. For "gay visibility," or something.

Amidst all this hullaballoo, the NFL commissioner spoke about potentially ending Pride Nights, since they make players uncomfortable. Crowder pointed out how boycotts like these are proof that they work, and that they're the only way to bridge the gap between citizens and corporations.

All in all, this was a much-needed win, particularly in light of the recent news cycle. The entire show is available exclusively on Rumble, and includes a few other topics like Rep. Jamaal Bowman's unhinged outburst and the coming "trans day of vengeance." You definitely won't wanna miss it.


>

<

title: Watch: Police Officers Tackle A Massive Rogue Alligator Wandering Around A Florida Neighborhood
description:
Police Officers in Tampa had a rough start to their morning yesterday when they had to wrangle an alligator. An over-9-foot alligator, to be precise.

Mr. Gator was just wandering around the neighborhood at approximately 1AM when the officers first encountered him. Video shows the officers cornering the alligator as it snaps at them. Two of the officers then sit on him from behind, pushing his mouth closed. Another officer comes in to duct tape his mouth shut. The officers reportedly stayed like this to keep him restrained until the certified gator trapper arrived, and it took four men to load the gator into the car.

\u201cA SCALY SITUATION \ud83d\udc0a Tampa police officers wrangled a 9-foot alligator found wandering through a neighborhood intersection early this morning. Read more: https://t.co/mtIVNDDQSF\u201d
— WFLA NEWS (@WFLA NEWS) 1680085725

The alligator trapper, Phil Walters, was surprised the officers had taken any action with the gator at all. He told a local news station that the Tampa Police Department typically doesn't get "down and dirty" when it comes to trapping gators. As to where the alligator may have originated from, Walters said he could have journeyed from a nearby river that connects to the road via a creek.

It seems this isn't a rare issue during mating season. Walters warned, "This time of year for whatever reason they start walking around, looking for love, looking for new places to eat – they’re hungry. This is the time of year to be really aware of your surroundings. Look where you put your feet and hands. Look before you jump in the pool. I take them out of pools this time of year. Look before you walk out the door. If you have a doggy door, look before you step out of bed."

Walters said he's already captured 10 other gators in the past week. He also said it's important for citizens to have situational awareness about potential rogue gators, since hitting one with a car would completely total the vehicle. Which makes sense, given that the creature is basically a dinosaur.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: Watch: Dutch TV show that exposes children to naked adults tries to normalize doing so
description:
As it turns out, America may not be the worst country trying to trans the kids. Take this Dutch TV show called "Simply Naked". The entire premise of the show is exposing children to naked adult bodies. For education, of course.

One episode featured trans adults, because of course, it did. And the purpose was to teach children how to accept trans bodies that have undergone various "gender-affirming procedures".

"In Simply Naked, adults get undressed, so that we can learn something about it. These kids, 10-12 years old, get the opportunity to ask them questions about their naked body."

It may be time to send the asteroid.

None
— Brandon Hunt (@Brandon Hunt) 1680151471

The host also told the children, "So it's not just male and female. There's an entire spectrum of genders besides male and female." One transgender person explained to the kids how gender dysphoria is in fact a feeling, but you can do something about it. Like cut off your perfectly healthy breasts.This person later told the children they felt euphoric when they woke up and no longer had breasts. A child asked, "so it feels a bit like flying?" And when the person said yes, the child said, "I want that too."

Another explained vaginoplasty, the process of created a "neovagina" from a healthy penis. A little girl told the camera, "At first you think, 'huh?' But later you realize it's actually pretty normal." Another boy said, "it is actually really normal."

I literally cannot believe this show is allowed on television, even if the contestants aren't normally transgender. Exposing children to naked adults is just wrong, let alone broadcasting it on television for everyone to see. How has our society fallen so far that we no longer even try to protect children's innocence?

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: Female students sue sorority over trans sorority sister, claiming  "her" constant boners make them uncomfortable
description:
A Wyoming sorority is embroiled in legal controversy. They allowed a biological male who claims to be a woman -- a transgender woman -- to pledge. The rub is this trans woman gets too many boners as -- she -- watches the other sisters change. So those sisters are suing. Apparently, having a sorority sister with a raging erection makes others uncomfortable.

Meet Artemis Langford. She shattered a glass ceiling last October when Kappa Kappa Gamma became the first sorority in Wyoming history to allow a transgender student into their ranks. Artemis is the girl wearing glasses in this video's thumbnail.

Wyoming University accepts transgender male into a top sorority | National Report youtu.be

Shocker, Artemis is also involved with the Democrat Party. (shout out to Daily Caller)

We have the BEST Legislative Intern! We were able to keep Democrats across the state informed and engaged this session in large part due to Artemis's hard work. Thank you, @ArtemisLangford!!! pic.twitter.com/oPtUZhOOGF
— Wyoming Democrats (@WyoDems) March 6, 2023

Not everyone finds the beautiful and brave shards of glass ceiling so beautiful and brave. Current and past sorority sisters are suing the Kappas claiming an adult human male does not become a woman just because "he tells others that he has a female ‘gender identity’" and "behaves in what he believes to be a stereotypically female manner."

They have a very specific complaint. While Artemis is attempting to live her best life as a woman, she remains sexually attracted to girls as she did when she was a he. The legal complaint refers to Artemis, the sorority sister, using he/him pronouns. We at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website are quoting the complaint verbatim until the AP Styleguide chimes in.

“One sorority member walked down the hall to take a shower, wearing only a towel. She felt an unsettling presence, turned, and saw Mr. Smith watching her silently."

“Mr. Smith has, while watching members enter the sorority house, had an erection visible through his leggings."

Welcome to 2023, where because trans outranks "girl born that way" on the Democrat Party's pound-for-pound most marginalized rankings, we expose girls to penises in the name of equity. Not unlike when a Dylan Mulvaney poseur tried pledging a sorority. Not only is it tolerance and inclusion to allow transwomen to rock out with their cocks out, but biological girls are also told there is something wrong with them for not wanting to see another girl's weiner.

As far back as 2017, CNN reported not wanting your daughter exposed to a dong made you a bigot. And not what used to be referred to as being a good parent.

In the name of the deity or deities of content, let's pray this court case goes all the way to the supreme court. I want "if the chick's got a dick you must acquit" to become a rallying cry for the Democrat Party.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Watch: Democrat congressman has meltdown over gun control, grabs GOP colleague in unhinged rant
description:
Yesterday, our pal Jamaal Bowman got a little feisty on the House floor. And by "feisty" I mean borderline unhinged.

Bowman was very upset over the recent Nashville shooting. As we all are. But he placed the blame on Republicans who don't want to ban guns. Bowman called his Republican colleagues "cowards" and repeatedly put his hands on Kentucky Rep. Thomas Massie.

\u201chttps://t.co/giNVWLiwSd\u201d
— Davy Jones (@Davy Jones) 1680137199

"Why the hell won't you do anything to save America's children? Let them explain that all the way up until election day 2024 [...] They're freaking cowards. They're gutless."

At this point, Rep. Massie strolled right up to him to ask what the heck he was talking about. Bowman screamed in reply, "I'm talking about gun violence."

Massie then pointed out there's never been a school shooting in a school that allows teachers to carry. Which Bowman did not like at all. He screamed about how "more guns lead to more death" before he began grabbing Massie and yelling about "data". Remember, these people run our country. Apparently.

How did Bowman feel about his little outburst? Well, he posted it to Twitter afterwards with the caption, "Republicans won't do SH*T when it comes to gun violence, but try to tell me to calm down. NO. We can't calm down. People are dying everyday while we wait."

So he must be pretty proud. What's really irritating is, Democrats aren't doing anything to stop gun violence either. They always yell about banning assault weapons and beat their fists in emotional speeches. But they're empty speeches. They play on people's emotions and create the illusion of action. Nothing is ever actually done. It's always a campaign for the next election cycle.

Better security for schools is such a simple, logical first step. So of course our lawmakers will never get it passed.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: Watch: Kevin Hart shares a terrifying experience that woke him up to the dark side of social media, phone addiction
description:
The boss was talking on the show this week about the dangers of social media and smartphone addiction. Particularly when it comes to Gen Z. People are hooked on their social media feeds. It's causing short-term memory loss. IQ scores are going down. It's a problem, and it's one I've been concerned about myself for the past few years. Starting with a Kevin Hart clip from Joe Rogan's podcast.

Hart shared a story about when he realized his smartphone had turned into more of a curse than a blessing.

Kevin Hart on the Dark Side of Social Media | Joe Rogan youtu.be

Hart makes two key points. One is the sudden realization of how addicted and reliant we've all become on our smartphones. For him, it was when his phone died while he was on a road trip and realized how little he knew without his phone: where to go, who to call, etc.

My sister lives three blocks away. I pick up my nieces and nephew from school all the time. If my phone ever died, I wouldn't know my sister's phone number without scrolling through my phone to find it. And even then, it's not the number. It's her name. If my phone ever died during a road trip, I'd still be pulled over to the side of the road.

The other Hart point was putting the phone away at a certain point of the day, and being present with his family. It's like the drug commercial from the 80s, "I LEARNED IT FROM WATCHING YOU." Kids pick up their device habits because we as adults always have ours in our hands.

It was after watching this clip I started to look at my own life and how addicted I am to "the scroll." These are three changes I made:

No phones at the dinner table. It's funny because adults fight me on this more than kids do.

Wear a watch. Part of the problem is I'm always grabbing my phone to check the time. Then I scroll through Twitter and check email before putting my phone back in my pocket...forgetting to check the time. Wearing a watch cuts down on that.

Listen to vinyl. Aka records, as opposed to Spotify or Music. In the olden days, you had media collections and a single stereo. Now I have my iPhone and eleventy different Bluetooth speakers. I love music but grew dependent on my phone to listen to it. Then when I would be listening to Spotify since my phone was in my hand I'd be too busy scrolling to listen to the music I had on. Putting on a record is my way to completely get off the grid for an hour or so.

You have to retrain your brain to accept the world will get along fine without you if you aren't connected to it 24/7. DeSantis stans and Trump marks will still be fighting. People will still argue over movies. The news will be every bit of "everything sucks," "everything is terrible," and "oh my God, someone do something" without you tweeting about it.

Take care of yourself first. Disconnect.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

Facebook doesn't want you reading this post or any others lately. Their algorithm hides our stories and shenanigans as best it can. The best way to stick it to Zuckerface? Bookmark LouderWithCrowder.com and check us out throughout the day! Also, follow us on Instagram and Twitter.

title: Watch: Woman has a nutty in Walmart, throws merch and screams how black lives - and her p***y - both matter
description:
Walmarts are the Waffle Houses of big box retailers. It's a breeding ground for web content. Though while the Waffle House tends to be more about throwing hands and/or throwing chairs, Walmart is where people go to have psychotic episodes. Our latest example is this specimen, choosing the pool-noodle aisle to go bowling and make a political statement about both Black-Americans and her vagina.

I believe this video is from last year, but it's getting a fresh look on Twitter this week.

pic.twitter.com/lzvWgcI7An
— Clown World ™ 🤡 (@ClownWorld_) March 29, 2023

I'm curious what this specimen's rationale is. What was the thought process or defining incident that led to her making a political statement in the aisle of Walmart?

For a while, black lives were the only ones that matter. If you said any other lives mattered, you weren't showing equity. And FORGET saying that "all lives matter." That's the most racist thing you can say. It's the hard-R of lives mattering.

Then trans lives came along, and black lives dropped on the left's pound-for-pound most marginalized rankings. Though black lives still rank above women, who on the regular get told by trans lives they don't matter at all.

This brings us to this lady. Is she saying that black lives DON'T matter? And "my pussy" is her version of a deez nuts joke? Or is it that she dreams of a world where her pussy matters at least as much as black lives? We're at a point in the 2020s where it's hard to tell what is woke progressism and what is unhinged lunacy.

We're just thankful someone had their camera out. Always remember to do it for the content, folks.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.
